comments.text:
+Gene Starwind
It just takes one person to get curious about why there's a prisoner who 
looks like they've been in a dark hole for years, maybe a new guard, and 
deciding to look into it. Or someone at the courts noticing an old casefile 
and reporting it.

Listen, my wife was looking into a job at a local prison. Yes, it's part of 
the standard training that you're not *allowed* to listen to anything that 
the prisoners say, because every last one of them has one thing in mind, 
finding a way out. No guard is going to *care* if you tell them that you 
haven't had your day in court, or in many cases whether you've had a phone 
call. Some prisons won't let prisoners in solitary confinement *make* phone 
calls. They're expected to make their phone calls when they get removed 
from solitary.

I want you to think about the fact that he screamed for days to get them to 
fix his tooth. He had to remove a rotten tooth *by hand* because they 
wouldn't pay attention to him. Do you know how bad tooth pain is? I split a 
wisdom tooth a few years back. It's the most intense pain I've been in in 
my life. I can't imagine being in that much pain and  reaching into my own 
mouth to tear a tooth from its socket. I'd rather just be shot in the head.

comments.text:
It sounds like he has serious mental illness, which makes communication 
with other people difficult even under the best circumstances--now imagine 
trying to talk to guards who view you as a dirty animal to cage up and keep 
away from. Also, if he moans about pain or mumbles something in his attempt 
to tell them something could only annoy them and thus justify their 
mistreating/ignoring his plight even more just out of spite. There's 
prejudgement possibly in play for DUI suspects. 

The report mentioned the reason he was placed in solitary because he 
suicidal, but the rest of the story does not make much sense because if the 
reason was accurate then he should have been monitored closely to keep him 
from killing himself and he should have been seen by a mental health 
professional to assess and provide treatment so he wouldn't be suicidal 
anymore and not need the more costly special cell and monitoring. They 
might have just made the reason up to cover up their sadistic act thinking, 
wrongly for people familiar with suicidal risks, that it would somehow make 
them seem like they cared about his health and wellbeing. However, two 
years of inhumane treatment through neglect makes their claim absurd on its 
face and damns them even more for not getting him the medical treatment 
that they admitted they knew about and concerned enough about him killing 
himself to take protective measures.

The state of Texas was forced to overhaul it's mental health laws last year 
after a study revealed that hundreds of people with serious mental illness 
sit in jail each year awaiting psychiatric evaluation and treatment in 
order for them to be deemed competent to stand trial. Most more never seen 
by anyone and wait for months, with some locked up for over two years with 
no trial date in sight. Similar to this man but not such a prolonged period 
in solitary confinement.

You should enlighten yourself with a little research on mankind as a social 
primate creature. The best explanation that science has to explain the 
extra complexity and huge size of the human brain versus other primates has 
nothing to do with our accepted perceptions of "intelligence" but has 
everything to do with the increased capacity for social processing, 
interpersonal memories ("bonding"), language, etc.

This isolation and treatment would drive anyone insane regardless of 
knowing about the coming payday or not. The point is that once you agree to 
it, absolutely nothing you say or do short of suicide can get you free from 
it. Processing that fact once it becomes reality will destroy your mind.

there added to the existing psychological torture. Check out the folks who 
volunteered to undergo water-boarding. They knew it would only last a 
couple of minutes; they knew their lives were never actually threatened; 
they even knew that the guys doing this to them were "friendlies" only 
doing it because they agreed to it. None of those facts help a bit - even 
the toughest S.O.B. "secret agents" of the NSA/CIA (?) undergoing

he was driving while drunk). A prisoner is placed in solitary confinement 
when they are seen as an extreme danger to themselves or to other inmates.

in a single person cell where he/she has very little to no interaction with 
other people.

Firstly: "New Mexico defines legal intoxication for purposes of driving as 
having a BAC of 0.08 or greater, in most cases."

http://www.newmexicodwilaw.com

0.08 BAC. NOT 0.8. To think that a state would set that as a limit is 
ridiculous. People have died from less.

Secondly; 7 beers will not get you anywhere near 0.8, even if you are a 
50kg woman and drink them in an hour. Also 7 beers will not get many people 
'roaring drunk'. I've had more than that since finishing work tonight and 
though I certainly shouldn't be operating a vehicle, I'm sure you can tell 
I'm not 'roaring drunk',

Thirdly: He IS innocent, as he was never proven guilty in a court of law, 
as is his right as a citizen. And drunk driving IS a minor offense, it's 
about as minor an offense there is that can get you put in jail, and even 
then, only in extreme cases.

comments.text:
+Blah b 0.08 is not in any way 'roaring drunk'.

That's about the level that SLIGHT impairment begins to develop. That's why 
the limit is there.

Also, you don't have to drink heavily to get to 0.8. Two beers will put an 
average male at about that level. You call that heavy drinking?

The drunk drivers that cause damage don't typically have a BAC of 0.04 or 
0.08. When drunks cause accidents on the roads in my country they usually 
have a BAC of 0.15+.

You approve of the things that happened to this person? Attitudes like that 
have caused more death and suffering throughout history than drunk driving 
ever will. It doesn't matter if he was guilty or not, that is not how you 
treat even the worse criminal.

comments.text:

They used to give variations in the reading, but not since the introduction 
of the second generation of portable tests, and the introduction of the 
15-20 minute waiting period for people who drank recently.

and South Poles had to have flipped many times throughout a long duration 
of time, suggesting that the Earth is very old. 
DEBUNKING: quite simple example of media and scientists altering results to 
get the outcome they want. There are NO magnetic reversals on the sea bed. 
here's the real unaltered data. There was a pattern of low and high 
magnetisms in the rock on the seabed that they scanned with a boat-tugged 
device, and a scientist decided to put a sinusoidal axis through the wave 
pattern and said " anything below the sinusoidal axis will be considered a 
negative magnetism and anything above will be positive."

you are wrong, and why we must care about this douche. 

       The United States judicial system on every level often makes major 
decisions in policy on what is called case law. That means that even one 
case that raises all of these issues can be cited in future cases to form 
decisions in court about them. In effect, what happens to even one person 
in the justice system in the USA can affect EVERYONE AFTER HIM IN THE SAME 
SITUATION. Basically the law in the justice system is something that is 
constantly evolving, like science in order to get it right, something that 
will never happen, but they are always theoretically coming closer. So this 
kind of sets a precedent in the court system in a way , in the same way 
that major cases like Roe V WAde, Bruce Rich V Fl DOC Dusky Vs United 
States etc. have. 


In the justice system in the US there is no room for even one case being 
handled badly, as like I said the entire system is evolving constantly and 
shaping itself. I guess I didnt explain that too well, my bad, but I hope

comments.text:
+noex100 "In the US, the death penalty can only be used for 1st degree 
murder."

In correct. Certain drug trafficking crimes can carry the death penalty.

"That is a completely logical use of the death penalty. Murderers, in most 
cases, don't deserve to live."

Untrue. Most murders are crimes of passion or done inadvertently in the 
commission of another crime.  Very few murderers would, or have, ever gone 
on to commit a second murder regardless of how long they spent locked up. 
That holds true in the U.S. and other countries that have <life sentences 
for murder.  If recidivism were the sole criteria, we'd let the murderers 
out and keep burglars locked up.  The murderers it could be logically 
argued deserve to die are serial and contract killers. The former are not 
that common and the latter are rarely caught.

There are no uses for the death penalty not based on *illogic* and emotion.
The only logical use of the death penalty is the protection of society or 
the staff and inmates of a prison. With the prisons we have today, none of 
those goals requires the death penalty.  Capital punishment doesn't even 
make sense in purely economic terms.

"In the EU, prisoners are treated extra-kindly and given light sentences, 
because Heaven forbid that a murderer should spend the rest of his life in 
prison, or be killed himself. What a tragedy that would be!"

Would you rather live somewhere with a very high crime rate that punishes 
criminals as severely as possible, or somewhere with an extremely low crime 
rate that doesn't punish criminals at all? According to you, you'd prefer 
the former.  The proof is in the pudding. The EU has a crime rate that 
wouldn't make a blip in the U.S. crime statistics.  Whatever they're doing, 
it works. What we do is expensive, often immoral and *doesn't work*.  

But I suppose you are one of those people for whom crime prevention is not 
the purpose of the criminal justice system. You want your blood and if it 
means the crime rate rises and even more people are hurt or killed, that's 
a small price for them to pay for your satisfaction.

"LOL The EU is such a stupid place. I'm so happy I don't live in one of 
those disgusting nations."

So are they. In fact, I'm pretty sure you'd have a hard time immigrating to 
the EU. They wouldn't want you. They don't want ignorant American 
immigrants. That window closed several decades ago. America is to the EU 
what Guatemala is to America. They don't want uneducated Americans with a 
propensity for violent behavior and nothing to contribute.  So, instead of 
living in a "stupid" place with low crime, better health and education and 
less social dysfunction, you're stuck in a country full of ignorant people, 
with a high crime rate, a crappy health and education system, endemic 
corruption and widespread social dysfunction. Congratulations. You're a 
*real* 'Murikan and a real 'Murikan never goes anywhere.
